alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 10 at 3:48PM MDT until October 13 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches with locally higher amounts possible over 10,000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Bighorn Mountains West and Bighorn Mountains Southeast. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, including along Highway 16 over Powder River Pass and Highway 14 over Granite Pass. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hunters and others heading into the backcountry should prepare for wet and cold conditions. Heavy, wet snow could make for difficult travel on unpaved mountain roads, especially above 8,000 feet.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West
